com.fortify.util.rest.connection

Class AbstractRestConnectionConfig<T extends AbstractRestConnectionConfig<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fortify.util.rest.connection.AbstractRestConnectionConfig<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Concrete AbstractRestConnectionConfig type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractRestConnectionWithUsernamePasswordConfig, ADORestConnectionConfig, RestConnection.RestConnectionBuilder

    public abstract class AbstractRestConnectionConfig<T extends AbstractRestConnectionConfig<T>>
extends Object
    This abstract base class allows for configuring AbstractRestConnection instances by setting properties like base URL, proxy configuration and additional connection properties. If a connection instance may be used by multiple threads, the multiThreaded(boolean) flag should be set to true to allow the connection instance to enable multi-threading features.
    Author:
    Ruud Senden

        setConnectionId(String)

      • setConnectionId

        protected void setConnectionId(String connectionId)

        By default, every connection is assigned a random id, which can be used to look up an existing connection from Connections. For example, AbstractJSONMapOnDemandLoaderWithConnection stores the connection id instead of the connection instance itself, to allow for serialization.

        Explicitly setting a connection id may be necessary if the same connection id needs to be available across multiple JVM invocations, for example if you need to de-serialize an AbstractJSONMapOnDemandLoaderWithConnection instance that was serialized by another JVM invocation.

        Parameters:
        connectionId - to be used for the connection
